abstract: Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff appoints her predecessor Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to be her chief of staff, in what some think is effort to shield him from corruption inquiry; judge issues injunction against move and incites debate by releasing taped conversations in which former president and his protege discuss ways to quash investigation.

headline.print_headline: Troubles Deepen for Ex-President of Brazil in Inquiry
headline.main: Tempers Flare in Brazil Over Intercepts of Calls by Ex-President ‘Lula’

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject

snippet: An uproar accompanied the former leader’s swearing-in as President Dilma Rousseff’s chief of staff on Thursday and the release of recordings of him suggesting intimidation of investigators.
lead_paragraph: An uproar accompanied the former leader’s swearing-in as President Dilma Rousseff’s chief of staff on Thursday and the release of recordings of him suggesting intimidation of investigators.
